Note: This calculator estimates New York state tax combined with federal taxes for 2025. NYC residents pay additional city tax. Consult a tax professional for accurate calculations.

New York State Income Tax Guide 2025

New York has a progressive state income tax system with 9 tax brackets ranging from 4% to 10.9%. Residents of New York City also pay an additional local income tax with 4 brackets ranging from 3.078% to 3.876%.

2025 New York State Tax Brackets (Single Filers)

Tax Rate Income Range
4%$0 - $8,500
4.5%$8,501 - $11,700
5.25%$11,701 - $13,900
5.5%$13,901 - $80,650
6%$80,651 - $215,400
6.85%$215,401 - $1,077,550
9.65%$1,077,551 - $5,000,000
10.3%$5,000,001 - $25,000,000
10.9%$25,000,001+

2025 NYC Tax Brackets (Single Filers)

Tax Rate Income Range
3.078%$0 - $12,000
3.762%$12,001 - $25,000
3.819%$25,001 - $50,000
3.876%$50,001+

New York Standard Deduction 2025

  • Single: $8,000
  • Married Filing Jointly: $16,050
  • Head of Household: $11,200

Key Features of New York Taxes

Progressive Tax System: New York uses a graduated tax system with 9 brackets where higher income is taxed at higher rates.

NYC Local Tax: New York City residents pay an additional local income tax on top of state tax, ranging from 3.078% to 3.876%.

Supplemental Tax: High earners with AGI over $107,650 may be subject to additional tax calculations.

Common New York Tax Deductions

  • Standard Deduction: $8,000 for single filers
  • Business Expenses: Same as federal
  • Retirement Contributions: 401(k), IRA
  • NYS College Savings: 529 plan contributions

Important: This calculator provides estimates for New York state income tax combined with federal taxes. NYC residents should check the NYC tax box. For complete tax planning, consult with a New York-licensed CPA or tax professional.
